title: "Veteran Boosting"
body:
Hey, can a Red possibly help me out please?

While I was  playing a game, someone contacted me claiming to have been someone from a previous game we played.

He also gave me a link to a site that's suppose to help boost elo or something.  The problem is, the account he spoke to me through is my smurf account and now I'm locked out.  Can someone help me out?

replies.body: its a copy paste, dude prob copy pasted it since it prob promised him rp or something

> [{quoted}](name=mudshark5,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=jddv2f0Z,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-22T02:15:53.472+0000)
>
> its a copy paste, dude prob copy pasted it since it prob promised him rp or something

The problem is he did it from my secondary account. In other words, nobody should be messing with it but me.

If someone has access to your account, you'll want to reach out to our accounts team right away! Create a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and select "I need help recovering my account" and fill out as much info as you can.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Hey I've got a question having something to do with that topic. What if someone gets somehow unintentionally my account data and plays games on my account using third programs and then the account gets a ban for terms of use violation, do I get my account back or will it stay suspended? I read several cases where ppl got access to accounts they shouldn't have and used third programs so that the account remained banned even though the owner did nothing do and had no access to it

Yes, if someone steals your account and plays games with cheats just for fun, Riot can tell and will reinstate your account after you prove your identity.

Of course, 99% of the time poeple come to the forums and says that happened, it's because they paid an elo booster to play on their account -- you're not getting your account back from that.
